titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Evelyn L. Pugh papers
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections and Archives C0012

archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: Materials in the collection support the study of John Stuart Mill and women's rights. They include the following: manuscript copy of "John Stuart Mill and Half the Human Race" by Evelyn L. Pugh; Pugh's master's thesis entitled: "The Socialist Party in the Election of 1932" (1959); her dissertation "John Stuart Mill in America: The Early Impact, 1843-1873"(1966); scholarly publications by Pugh; course syllabi and course materials; bibliographic lists and bibliographic and note card files.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Evelyn L. Pugh papers, Collection #C0012, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Robert E. Pugh in 1989.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in March 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Evelyn L. Pugh was a faculty member in the Department of History at George Mason University from 1965 to 1987, specializing in the study of John Stuart Mill and women's rights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in the collection support the study of Mill and women's rights. They include the following: manuscript copy of "John Stuart Mill and Half the Human Race" by Evelyn L. Pugh; Pugh's master's thesis entitled: "The Socialist Party in the Election of 1932" (1959); her dissertation "John Stuart Mill in America: The Early Impact, 1843-1873"(1966); scholarly publications by Pugh; course syllabi and course materials; bibliographic lists and bibliographic and note card files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by subject.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds the papers of GMU history professor Roy Rosenzweig.
